tool_description:
Lookup active tickers using fuzzy Security name search from exchanges worldwide.
Get the Security name from the ticker.
Check if a company is in the S&P 500 or get a list of all SP500 companies.
Get the historical Price and Volume of security.
Get the sentiment of companies mentioned in an article.
name: Stock, Ticker, Security and Company Search database
title: Stock, Ticker, Security and Company Search database
tool_name: Stock, Ticker, Security and Company Search database

api_list.name: /security_price_volume
api_list.description: Returns end of day Price and Volume for a security

required_parameters.name: date
required_parameters.description:
It needs a date from which the historical price and volume will be provided.
If on that date there is an exchange holiday or data is not available, then it will return previous days data

required_parameters.name: ticker
required_parameters.description:
The ticker should having following pattern:
<Exchange_Code>:<Security_Ticker>

api_list.name: /sp500_active_list
api_list.description: List all the SP500 active companies
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://stock-ticker-security-and-company-search-database.p.rapidapi.com/sp500_active_list"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "stock-ticker-security-and-company-search-database.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://stock-ticker-security-and-company-search-database.p.rapidapi.com/sp500_active_list"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "stock-ticker-security-and-company-search-database.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /all_search get result by ticker or security_term
api_list.description: In a single call search by ticker OR security_term

api_list.name: /company_sentiment
api_list.description: Extract securities and sentiment towards those securities from a free form text using an advanced AI

required_parameters.name: text
required_parameters.default: Tesla gave investors a few reasons to be bullish last week. News broke on Thursday that CEO Elon Musk had hired someone to take over his position as CEO at privately held social network Twitter. The move will likely free up more of Musk's time, which was already split between Tesla, SpaceX, Twitter, and some smaller ventures like The Boring Company.

api_list.name: /sp500_search by Ticker
api_list.description: Check if security is currently listed in the S&P 500 by Ticker (or Symbol)

api_list.name: /all_search by Ticker
api_list.description:
Search security by ticker

You can also input different exchanges, for example:

```
ticker=NASDAQ:AAPL
ticker=NYSE:BA
```

api_list.name: /sp500_search by Security Term
api_list.description: Search security by providing the first few words for the security or the company name

api_list.name: /all_search by Exchange and Ticker
api_list.description:
Search security by ticker

You can also input different exchanges, for example:

```
ticker=NASDAQ:AAPL
ticker=NYSE:BA
```

api_list.name: /all_search by Security Term
api_list.description: Search security by providing the first few words for the security or the company name

api_list.name: /all_search get single security by term search
api_list.description:
Search security by providing the first few words for the security or the company name

Use optional  query param 
`result_type=short`, which will return the top-most similar only one security, which matches your search term.
Otherwise, it will return all the security, which starts with the term you provided.
